channel.title: CVE Feed for NetIQ -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for NetIQ -- all products

item.title: CVE-2017-9279|2024-08-05T17:02:44.187Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager
item.description: NetIQ Identity Manager before 4.5.6.1 allowed uploading files with double extensions or non-image content in the Themes handling of the User Application Administration, allowing malicious user administrators to potentially execute code or mislead users.

item.title: CVE-2018-1346|2024-08-05T03:59:38.700Z -- netiq -- edirectory
item.description: Addresses denial of service attack to eDirectory versions prior to 9.1.

item.title: CVE-2017-7427|2024-08-05T16:04:11.703Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager
item.description: Multiple cross site scripting attacks were found in the Identity Manager Plug-in, hosted on iManager 2.7.7.7, before Identity Manager 4.6.1. In certain scenarios it was possible to execute arbitrary JavaScript code in the context of vulnerable application, via user.Context in the Object Selector, via vdtData in the Version discovery and via nextFrame in the Object Inspector and via Host GUID in the System details plugins.

item.title: CVE-2017-7437|2024-08-05T16:04:11.426Z -- netiq -- privileged%20account%20manager
item.description: NetIQ Privileged Account Manager before 3.1 Patch Update 3 allowed cross site scripting attacks via the "type" and "account" parameters of json requests.

item.title: CVE-2018-1349|2024-08-05T03:59:38.707Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager
item.description: The NetIQ Identity Manager driver log file, in versions prior to 4.7, provides details that could aid in system or configuration enumeration.

item.title: CVE-2017-7429|2024-08-05T16:04:11.244Z -- netiq -- edirectory
item.description: The certificate upload in NetIQ eDirectory PKI plugin before 8.8.8 Patch 10 Hotfix 1 could be abused to upload JSP code which could be used by authenticated attackers to execute JSP applets on the iManager server.

item.title: CVE-2017-7434|2024-08-05T16:04:11.285Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager
item.description: In the JDBC driver of NetIQ Identity Manager before 4.6 sending out incorrect XML configurations could result in passwords being logged into exception logfiles.

item.title: CVE-2018-12461|2024-08-05T08:38:05.686Z -- netiq -- edirectory
item.description: Fixed issues with NetIQ eDirectory prior to 9.1.1 when checking certificate revocation.

item.title: CVE-2018-12462|2024-08-05T08:38:06.153Z -- netiq -- imanager
item.description: NetIQ iManager 3.1.1 addresses potential XSS vulnerabilities.

item.title: CVE-2017-9275|2024-08-05T17:02:44.148Z -- netiq -- identity%20reporting
item.description: NetIQ Identity Reporting, in versions prior to 5.5 Service Pack 1, is susceptible to an XSS attack.

item.title: CVE-2017-9278|2024-08-05T17:02:44.145Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager%20oracle%20ebs%20driver
item.description: The NetIQ Identity Manager Oracle EBS driver before 4.0.2.0 sent EBS logs containing the driver authentication password, potentially disclosing this to attackers able to read the EBS tables.

item.title: CVE-2017-5189|2024-08-05T14:55:35.377Z -- netiq -- imanager
item.description: NetIQ iManager before 3.0.3 delivered a SSL private key in a Java application (JAR file) for authentication to Sentinel, allowing attackers to extract and establish their own connections to the Sentinel appliance.

item.title: CVE-2018-7678|2024-08-05T06:31:05.113Z -- netiq -- netiq%20access%20manager%20%28nam%29%20admin%20console
item.description: A cross site scripting vulnerability exist in the Administration Console in NetIQ Access Manager (NAM) 4.3 and 4.4.

item.title: CVE-2018-1350|2024-08-05T03:59:38.783Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager
item.description: The NetIQ Identity Manager driver log file, in versions prior to 4.7, provides details that could aid in system enumeration.

item.title: CVE-2018-7677|2024-08-05T06:31:05.048Z -- netiq -- netiq%20access%20manager%20%28nam%29%20admin%20console
item.description: A CSRF exposure exists in NetIQ Access Manager (NAM) 4.4 Identity Server component.

item.title: CVE-2018-1348|2024-08-05T03:59:38.587Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager
item.description: NetIQ Identity Manager driver, in versions prior to 4.7, allows for an SSL handshake renegotiation which could result in a MITM attack.

item.title: CVE-2018-7674|2024-08-05T06:31:05.078Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager
item.description: The NetIQ Identity Manager user console, in versions prior to 4.7, is susceptible to URL redirection.

item.title: CVE-2018-1347|2024-08-05T03:59:38.588Z -- netiq -- imanager
item.description: The administrative web interface in NetIQ iManager, versions prior to 3.1, are vulnerable to reflected cross site scripting.

item.title: CVE-2018-7676|2024-08-05T06:31:05.092Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager
item.description: The NetIQ Identity Manager, in versions prior to 4.7, userapp with log / trace enabled may leak sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2017-9285|2024-08-05T17:02:44.179Z -- netiq -- edirectory
item.description: NetIQ eDirectory before 9.0 SP4 did not enforce login restrictions when "ebaclient" was used, allowing unpermitted access to eDirectory services.

item.title: CVE-2017-9276|2024-08-05T17:02:44.180Z -- netiq -- access%20manager
item.description: Novell Access Manager iManager before 4.3.3 did not validate parameters so that cross site scripting content could be reflected back into the result page using the "a" parameter.

item.title: CVE-2017-7419|2024-08-05T16:04:11.275Z -- netiq -- access%20manager
item.description: A OAuth application in NetIQ Access Manager 4.3 before 4.3.2 and 4.2 before 4.2.4 allowed cross site scripting attacks due to unescaped "description" field that could be specified by the provider.

item.title: CVE-2017-9280|2024-08-05T17:02:44.156Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager%20applications
item.description: Some NetIQ Identity Manager Applications before Identity Manager 4.5.6.1 included the session token in GET URLs, potentially allowing exposure of user sessions to untrusted third parties via proxies, referer urls or similar.

item.title: CVE-2017-9284|2024-08-05T17:02:44.161Z -- netiq -- idm%20-%20identity%20applications
item.description: IDM 4.6 Identity Applications prior to 4.6.2.1 may expose sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2018-7673|2024-08-05T06:31:05.114Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager
item.description: The NetIQ Identity Manager communication channel, in versions prior to 4.7, is susceptible to a DoS attack.

item.title: CVE-2018-1345|2024-08-05T03:59:38.253Z -- netiq -- imanager
item.description: NetIQ iManager, versions prior to 3.1, under some circumstances could be susceptible to an elevation of privilege attack.

item.title: CVE-2017-7438|2024-08-05T16:04:11.171Z -- netiq -- privileged%20account%20manager
item.description: NetIQ Privileged Account Manager before 3.1 Patch Update 3 allowed cross site scripting attacks via javascript DOM modification using the supplied cookie parameter.

item.title: CVE-2017-7426|2024-08-05T16:04:11.181Z -- netiq -- identity%20manager%20plug-ins
item.description: The NetIQ Identity Manager Plugins before 4.6.1 contained various XML External XML Entity (XXE) handling flaws that could be used by attackers to leak information or cause denial of service attacks.

item.title: CVE-2018-1344|2024-08-05T03:59:38.599Z -- netiq -- imanager
item.description: Addresses potential communication downgrade attack in NetIQ iManager versions prior to 3.1
